alert.note: Alert for Clinton; Essex (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued October 07 at 11:02PM EDT until October 08 at 8:20PM EDT by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 245 AM EDT SUNDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of northern New York, including the following counties, Clinton and Essex. * WHEN...Until 245 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Streams continue to rise due to excess runoff from current rainfall. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1101 PM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the warned area. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.25 to 0.75 inches are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Plattsburgh, Plattsburgh International Airport, Peru, Beekmantown, Schuyler Falls, Chazy, Saranac, Mooers, Altona, Rouses Point, Jericho, Dannemora, Peasleeville, Keeseville, Au Sable Forks, Champlain, Black Brook, West Plattsburgh and Cadyville. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
